title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel depicting the decadence and excess of the Jazz Age in America.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A classic novel exploring themes of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel depicting a totalitarian regime and the struggle for freedom.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel exploring societal norms and love in early 19th century England.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A coming-of-age novel following the journey of a teenager through New York City.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel following the adventures of Bilbo Baggins as he journeys to reclaim the Lonely Mountain.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic fantasy trilogy following the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The first book in the Harry Potter series, following the young wizard Harry Potter as he discovers his magical heritage.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A thriller novel following symbologist Robert Langdon as he investigates a murder in Paris.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A psychological thriller novel exploring the complexities of marriage and deception.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: A mystery about a young woman living in the marshes of North Carolina.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about the author's journey from a survivalist family in Idaho to Cambridge University.

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
description: A retelling of the story of Circe, the Greek goddess, from her perspective.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychological thriller about a woman who stops speaking after killing her husband.

title: The Testaments
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A sequel to The Handmaid's Tale, set fifteen years after the events of the first book.

title: Normal People
author: Sally Rooney
description: A love story about two young people from different backgrounds in Ireland.

title: Daisy Jones & The Six
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
description: A novel about the rise and fall of a fictional 1970s rock band.

title: The Water Dancer
author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
description: A historical novel about a young man born into slavery who discovers he has a mysterious power.

title: Red, White & Royal Blue
author: Casey McQuiston
description: A romantic comedy about the First Son of the United States falling in love with a British prince.

title: The Nickel Boys
author: Colson Whitehead
description: A novel inspired by the true story of a reform school in Florida that operated for over one hundred years and warped the lives of thousands of children.
